conclusion: Analyze the motion of the rod and the frame, calculate the potential energy change, and use this to determine the charge on the capacitor.

The image shows a horizontal metal ring with a radius of 0.2 m, fixed and rotating with an angular velocity of 600 rad/s. Two metal rods, each with a length of 0.2 m, are placed along the diameter of the ring. A uniform magnetic field with a magnetic induction strength of B1 exists in the left half of the ring. A capacitor with a capacitance of 0.09 F is connected between two parallel horizontal metal tracks with a distance of l1. A metal rod ab is placed perpendicularly to the track near the left edge within the magnetic field region. A '[' shaped metal frame fcde is placed on the horizontal section of the insulated tracks.

The rod ab is ejected out of the magnetic field and sticks to the '[' shaped frame, forming a closed frame abcd. The center of mass of the frame abcd rises by 0.2 m on the inclined track before returning into the magnetic field.
Calculate the potential energy change of the frame: ΔPE = m * g * h = 0.01 kg * 9.8 m/s² * 0.2 m = 0.0196 J.
The potential energy change is equal to the energy stored in the capacitor: ΔPE = (1/2) * C * V².
Calculate the charge Q on the capacitor: Q = C * V = 0.09 F * 2 V = 0.18 C.
Determine which plate is positively charged: The plate M is positively charged because it is connected to the terminal 1, which is the positive terminal of the battery.
The amount of charge Q on the capacitor after it is fully charged is 0.18 C. The plate M is positively charged.
